sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1:
Suppose set A = {1, 2, 3} and set B = {2, 3, 4}. Calculate the following:
1. (A ∆ B) × A
2. A × (A ∆ B)
3. (B ∆ A) × B
4. B × (A ∆ B)
Determine if the symmetric difference of two sets is associative with respect to Cartesian product.
